page.title: 19RECREATION:POTTERIES,M'THON.
page.content: On the 17th June 1985, the fourth Potteries Marathon took place, sponsored by Century Oils. 2500 people took part including 43 people from Limoges. Many cheering spectators encouraged the runners along the 26 mile route. The weather was fine and the running conditions superb. 2 hours 19.5 minutes after the 10am start the winner, Harry Clague from St. Helens came in. Clague's only opposition, Peter Orton from Burton came second. Third man home was Colin Kirkham who was also the first over forty veteran to cross the line. The first Limoges runner to finish was 52 year old Maurice Petit. Christine Kilkenny was the first lady to finish with 2-54-21. She easily won after taking the lead from Hem Heath Colliery. Christine received a Royal Doulton crystal urn as her prize.
